title: 431. Why Can’t Schools Get What the N.F.L. Has?
description: Thanks to daily Covid testing and regimented protocols, the new football season is underway. Meanwhile, most teachers, students, and parents are essentially waiting for the storm to pass. And school isn’t even a contact sport (usually).
author: editor@freakonomics.com (Freakonomics Radio + Stitcher)
content:encoded: Thanks to daily Covid testing and regimented protocols, the new football season is underway. Meanwhile, most teachers, students, and parents are essentially waiting for the storm to pass. And school isn’t even a contact sport (usually).
